brewery.brewery_description:
The Orkney Brewery was one of Scotland’s first independent micro–breweries and started brewing in 1988, in what was once an old schoolhouse in Quoyloo. We are a genuine island brewery that crafts a superb range of beers. 

North island values shape our resolute approach to brewing, resulting in world class, award-winning beers. We are honest, resilient, we work hard together and have an innate desire to perfect. We need to get it right first time, every time. We don’t believe in wasting resources and we are friends to the environment we dwell in. 

We brew iconic Scottish ales Dark Island, Red MacGregor, Dragonhead and Skull Splitter. In addition, we offer progressive pale ale Orkney Gold and the extraordinary Dark Island Reserve, aged in whisky oak casks. Norman Sinclair whose father had actually enjoyed his school years in the same building took over the tenure in 2006.  He quickly developed a custom built brewhouse adjoining the schoolhouse and by doing so created the original classroom into a 5 Star visitor centre.

items.checkin_comment: Exceptional for a low ABV beer.  Nice hops.

beer.beer_description: With LUMI, we thought we'd bring our lightest refreshment so far. This low strength pale ale, brewed to only 1.0% Abv is gluten free and suitable for vegetarians as well as vegans. Hopefully we can bring some light enjoyment to your evenings and allow some earlier rises, to the dawn that follows. In Old Norse, the word for Light Bringer was LUMI. Although light on a few things you would normally expect in beer, to ensure no compromise, this beer has a triple boost. Three tropical happy fruity flavours, so LUMI is not just flavoursome but very satisfying.

items.badge_description: It's the final week! Week 4 wraps with the last 3 styles of this year's Year in Beer Style Hunt. You've just tried one of three available styles during the week.

beer.beer_description:
Skull Splitter has a rich fruity wine-like complexity. Flavours include fresh and dried fruits; warm exotic spice and mellow summer fruity notes.  

Sophisticated, satiny smooth and full flavoured beer. It is one of our strongest beers, named after Thorfinn Einarsson the 7th Viking Earl of Orkney. 

Pair with fruit puddings and or rich dark meats such as venison or alternatively, Skullsplitter is a delight as a digestif.

items.badge_description: Looking for more kick than a session beer, but want to be able to stay for a few rounds? You have to keep it in the middle. That's 50 beers with an ABV greater than 5% and less than 10%. Try 5 more for Level 11!

beer.beer_description: The extraordinary Orcadian Ale. Dark Island Reserve is created by maturing Orkney Brewery’s Dark Island Ale in aged single malt whisky casks for three months.

Island life is a pale golden ale with citrus fruit aromas. Mouth-watering flavours of grapefruit and peach, lead to a crisp bitter zesty finish, to be enjoyed time and time again. This beer is special, much like life on our islands. Orkney has been regularly recognised as one of the finest places to live in the British Isles.  So, like the easy-going enjoyment of your personal island retreat, take your time, relax and indulge

This beer is special, much like life on our islands. Orkney has been regularly recognised as one of the finest places to live in the British Isles.  So, like the easy-going enjoyment of your personal island retreat, take your time, relax and indulge

Island life is a pale golden ale with citrus fruit aromas. Mouth-watering flavours of grapefruit and peach, lead to a crisp bitter zesty finish, to be enjoyed time and time again. This beer is special, much like life on our islands. Orkney has been regularly recognised as one of the finest places to live in the British Isles.  So, like the easy-going enjoyment of your personal island retreat, take your time, relax and indulge

For Brodgar, we went back as far as we could, to source an ancient grain, Bere malt, to offer a sense of the past, pairing with rye, to create Brodgar Bere, a rich and complex full flavoured beer. 
The heart of Neolithic Orkney stretches from the stone circle on the hill, down to the Ness settlement at the headland, the narrow peninsula reaching out to touch Stenness. BRODGAR or bridge farm in old Norse, may be the origin of civilisation in the British Isles. Like elsewhere in the world, where society gathered, there was a need for water and from that came brewing.

items.checkin_comment: Toasted malt. Also smoky like scotch whiskey

Pair with fruit puddings and or rich dark meats such as venison or alternatively, Skullsplitter is a delight as a digestif.

items.checkin_comment: To finish earlier this evening. (1 pint)

beer.beer_description:
Cliff Edge IPA is a brilliant bronze beer with a tantalising trio of American hops. Pushing you to the edge of your senses, with an intense impact of piney and spicy fruit flavours, before dropping to a crash of bitter zestiness. 

The Cliffs of Yesnaby, one of Orkney’s many landmarks, are just a few miles south of our brewery, and the coastal walks are memorable, much like this beer. 

Pair with spicy dishes such as Indian or Mexican

items.badge_description: You've just tried one of three available styles from Style Hunt - Ale Trail!

beer.beer_description: The extraordinary Orcadian Ale. Dark Island Reserve is created by maturing Orkney Brewery’s Dark Island Ale in aged single malt whisky casks for three months.

items.badge_description: Happy Untappd anniversary to you! Thanks for sticking around and drinking socially with us. Cheers! That's 11 years on Untappd!

Round and round the wheel goes! Which style you’ll be drinking, nobody knows! Your desire to explore different styles is inspiring. Keep it up! That's a check-in to at least 5 different styles. Try 5 more for Level 2!

beer.beer_description:
Dark Island is an iconic beer. A gold standard-bearer for crafted premium Scottish ales, it almost needs no introduction. It offers ripe, fruity and roast coffee aromas with flavours of dark chocolate, dates and nuts, from the combination of roasted malts and robust hops. 

Pair with cheese of any strength, chargrilled vegetables, steaks, roast beef or lamb dishes. This deeply delicious beer also handles the haggis rather well.

items.badge_description: Dispensed traditionally by hand pump, cask beers are best served at 55°F. This temperature allows all of the flavor nuances to emerge and permits appreciation of the often unfiltered texture. That's 75 checkins with the serving style of Cask! Try 5 more for Level 16!

beer.beer_description:

Pair with cheese of any strength, chargrilled vegetables, steaks, roast beef or lamb dishes. This deeply delicious beer also handles the haggis rather well.

items.badge_description: Your quest to quench your thirst leaves no stone unturned! That's at least 45 distinct venues!

There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 210 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 43!

Orkney has been regularly recognised as one of the finest places to live in the British Isles.  So, like the easy-going enjoyment of your personal island retreat, take your time, relax and indulge

items.badge_description: Want to enjoy a day of brews, but need to keep your wits sharp? There are plenty of delicious brews under 5% for you to sip on throughout the day. That's 115 different beers with an ABV of 5% and lower. Try 5 more for Level 24!

user.bio:
Lebe dein leben eines tages stirbt jeder.
A Fahrzüg Schrube isch balsam fürd Seele.

beer.beer_description:
Red MacGregor is a mighty beer indeed. It has a wonderfully complex aroma of fruity hop zest, spiciness and rich malts. Initial toasted and caramel malt, then mouth-watering citrus hop fruits, gives way to a clean, fruity, refreshing hop bitterness. 

One of the first beers in Scotland, that expressively used the American hop Cascade, for citrusy fruit flavours. 

Pair with casseroles, smoked cheese, hearty pies and soups

items.badge_description: Thanks for staying at home, and checking in with Untappd! It allows us to stay connected to a community of beer lovers, just like you, even if we can't be in the same physical location. From our home to yours, cheers and stay safe!

While spontaneity can be fun, sometimes you want to make sure your adventure will rock. Checkout the menu at an Untappd Verified Venue before visiting and know exactly what’s on tap! That's 425 check-ins at venue that is verified.  Try 5 more for Level 86!
Unlike The Highlander from TV, there are more than just one brewery in Scotland fighting the great craft beer war. Join the battle. No kilt required. Try 5 more for Level 11.

beer.beer_description:
Puffin is a burnished bronze beer with aromas of spices, sweet nutty malt and dark fruits. An inviting rich malt palate of coffee and dark chocolate, is balanced with notes of herbs and spicy fruitiness, with a long bitter and roast malt finish. 

Puffins are local inhabitants to the islands and are playfully known as 'clowns of the sea' or 'sea parrots’. 

Pair with mild cheese, roast chicken or pork.

items.badge_description: There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 295 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 60!

beer.beer_description:
Skull Splitter has a rich fruity wine-like complexity. Flavours include fresh and dried fruits; warm exotic spice and mellow summer fruity notes.  

Sophisticated, satiny smooth and full flavoured beer. It is one of our strongest beers, named after Thorfinn Einarsson the 7th Viking Earl of Orkney. 

Pair with fruit puddings and or rich dark meats such as venison or alternatively, Skullsplitter is a delight as a digestif.

Dark Island is an iconic beer. A gold standard-bearer for crafted premium Scottish ales, it almost needs no introduction. It offers ripe, fruity and roast coffee aromas with flavours of dark chocolate, dates and nuts, from the combination of roasted malts and robust hops. 

Pair with cheese of any strength, chargrilled vegetables, steaks, roast beef or lamb dishes. This deeply delicious beer also handles the haggis rather well.

Red MacGregor is a mighty beer indeed. It has a wonderfully complex aroma of fruity hop zest, spiciness and rich malts. Initial toasted and caramel malt, then mouth-watering citrus hop fruits, gives way to a clean, fruity, refreshing hop bitterness. 

One of the first beers in Scotland, that expressively used the American hop Cascade, for citrusy fruit flavours. 

Pair with casseroles, smoked cheese, hearty pies and soups

Northern Light combines delicate pale malt character with a spice, citrus and apricot hoppiness. Refreshing citrus flavours combine with hints of fresh bread; giving way to a clean refreshing hoppy aftertaste. 

It has a delicious crisp hop character without being overly aggressive, so perfect refreshment. 

Named after the lights of the aurora, regularly viewed in our northern skies. Pair with salads, chicken and seafood

Dragonhead is brimming over with rich roast malt and roast barley flavours. Aromas of bitter chocolate, roast coffee and spicy dark fruits are complemented by a complex, bitter blend of hop varieties. 

Dark, intense and full-flavoured, it is our tribute to the Vikings and their cultural legacy in Orkney. The first thing to touch the islands would have been their long ship’s Dragonhead. 

Pair with rich fruit or chocolate puddings.

Corncrake is an irresistible golden ale. New world hops compliment the biscuity pale malt, to provide a thirst-quenching ale, with fruit flavours of lemon, apricot and peach. 

Named after the rare and elusive bird which migrates to Orkney to breed. One such bird landed in front of the brewery, so we decided to honour our new feathered friend, with a brew dedicated to its endeavour. 

Pair with fried food, white meat and apple pie.

Orkney Gold is a shimmering bright golden beer. It has aromas of spice and fruit, with a crisp burst of lemon zest, then more peach and tangerine hop flavours. 

This beer was our first brew, in the fresh golden age of new world craft brewing, hence the name. We like to think we have got this beer just right, for you to discover at your leisure. 

Enjoy with spicy foods and crisp salads.

Raven is pale amber ale with a fruity and spicy hop aroma, with malt flavours both biscuity and toasty. This is beautifully balanced with a clean spicy orangey bitterness. 

Viking folklore claimed the Raven had the eyes and ears of Odin himself. Used on long voyages to guide the Viking long ships, these birds were released on the seas and if they did not return, it signalled that land was close. 

Pair with mild cheeses and vegetarian dishes.
The extraordinary Orcadian Ale. Dark Island Reserve is created by maturing Orkney Brewery’s Dark Island Ale in aged single malt whisky casks for three months.

This is a deep amber beer with aromas and flavours of fruit, rich malt, cinnamon and ginger, exhibiting all the warming characteristics of the renowned Scottish fruit pudding. The dish itself, was made with dried fruit and spices. The “cloot” was the cloth, for which the mix was wrapped in, whilst being steamed. The dumpling was made to celebrate birthdays, weddings and the festive season, when trinkets and coins were dropped into the mixture. So, when you fancy a drop of Clootie, mind and pour carefully!

Puffin is a burnished bronze beer with aromas of spices, sweet nutty malt and dark fruits. An inviting rich malt palate of coffee and dark chocolate, is balanced with notes of herbs and spicy fruitiness, with a long bitter and roast malt finish. 

Puffins are local inhabitants to the islands and are playfully known as 'clowns of the sea' or 'sea parrots’. 

Pair with mild cheese, roast chicken or pork.

Cliff Edge IPA is a brilliant bronze beer with a tantalising trio of American hops. Pushing you to the edge of your senses, with an intense impact of piney and spicy fruit flavours, before dropping to a crash of bitter zestiness. 

The Cliffs of Yesnaby, one of Orkney’s many landmarks, are just a few miles south of our brewery, and the coastal walks are memorable, much like this beer. 

Pair with spicy dishes such as Indian or Mexican

Island life is a pale golden ale with citrus fruit aromas. Mouth-watering flavours of grapefruit and peach, lead to a crisp bitter zesty finish, to be enjoyed time and time again. This beer is special, much like life on our islands. Orkney has been regularly recognised as one of the finest places to live in the British Isles.  So, like the easy-going enjoyment of your personal island retreat, take your time, relax and indulge

Boulder Beach is a bright 4.4% golden, single hop American Pale Ale.  The  Columbus hop offers both aroma and bitterness with  offers herbal and strong lemon citrus flavours, with a bold punchy hoppy finish for such a smooth beer. 

Our boulder beach on Orkney is in Rackwick Bay, where there are an array of rocks with varied colours. The boulders are worn smooth by the frequent tides. This natural phenomenon seems almost from out of this world, a bit like this beer.

Blond beer, lively lemon and lime aromas, then stone fruit flavours with biscuit malt and a creamy finish. This brew uses the innovative New Zealand Hop Motueka. This hop alongside a touch of biscuity Vienna malt offers flavours lemon meringue.

Orkney is not just an island but an archipelago of 70 islands. There is over 500 miles of coastline with constant waves breaking onto our many beaches. Life is essentially one long beach party as we watch the waves coming in.

Deep Golden Ale with summer scents of soft and dark fruit. Flavours of citrus and mango with a soft malt background, creamy, hoppy and  a bittersweet fruity finish. 

Brewed in tribute to an iconic Orcadian landmark. The Old Man O’ Hoy is a near vertical 140 metre sea stack off the west coast of Hoy.  It is visible to the many thousands of daily visitors who come by ferry from the mainland to Stromness. The stack is believed to be only around 250 years old and unfortunately may being not be with us forever.  So please raise a toast to the Old Man O’ Hoy while he is still standing
Brewed to celebrate the brewery's 30th anniversary. The use of peat-smoked malt provides a delicate smokiness in the aroma and flavour, complimented by caramel notes and a fruity hop finish.

North Point is a 4.3% Porter which is dark chocolate in colour, with hints of toffee, caramel and coffee. Medium bodied beer with bitter chocolate flavours and a smooth dry bitter hoppy finish. Noup Head on Westray is our North Point, the end of a spectacular coast of cliffs, caves and seabird colonies. Even on a bright day with a cool breeze, so you may need something more substantial than pale ale.
ORKNEY LOCH IS A GOLDEN AMBER ALE, WITH FRUIT AND SPICE AROMAS, A GENTLE MALTINESS AND THEN MORE TROPICAL FRUIT FLAVOURS

The beer is bright and golden, with citrus aromas and tropical flavours, leading to a spicy, hoppy and creamy finish. Waulkmill bay is our tidal bay, situated in the Southwest of mainland Orkney, between Kirkwall and Orphir. When the tide is out, the bay has one of the biggest beaches on Orkney, a spectacular stretch of sand, stretching out to Scapa Flow and it slips almost entirely away from view, when the sea claims its ‘secret’ bay back.

White Shores White IPA is a pale hazy 4.2% beer, a fusion between a Wit Bier and a modern Session IPA. Brewed with Belgian Ale yeast wheat, hops from the USA as well as New Zealand for some juicy hoppiness. It is hazy pale, spicy, smooth and creamy with a fruity, hoppy spicy finish

Orca is 4.2% stout which is deep dark black with a creamy head.  Rich and full flavoured with creamy chocolate, nuts and notes of coffee from the roasted barley, with s  bittersweet balance from the oats. Orcas, despite their reputation, are quite social amongst themselves. Hoxa Head, South Ronaldsay, is one of the UK’s best  places to whale watch. It will be worth the  wait,  like a pour of a pint  of this Stout.

Skara Blonde is brewed with citrusy Columbus, piny Simcoe, and tangy Amarillo hops, for unforgettable flavours which are not just memorable but moreish.
The site of the neolithic village was known as Skara Brae, long before the settlement was uncovered by a storm. SKARA has a few potential Nordic translations but most point to the characteristics of the dunes themselves. Regardless of the mystery, there is no doubt the settlement is now world renowned. Stretching our horizons, we brewed this unique beer, connecting the old world to the new, from one west coast to another.
Bay of Caves is a black beer, with roast malt and citrusy fruit aromas. Its medium bodied, with flavours of bitter chocolate, black grape and spiced fruit.

This beer has been brewed and bottled by 
the Orkney Brewery, to celebrate the life 
of John Rae. Orkney’s Victorian Arctic 
Hero. He explored more of the Arctic than 
anyone: Is famed for finding the final link 
of The Northwest Passage: Was named 
Long Strides {Aglooka} by the Inuit, who 
told him the tragic fate of Franklin’s
Expedition. In fitting tribute, this golden 
pale ale has bold aromas and flavours. 
The hops offer characteristics of mango, 
pineapple and apricot in the aroma. 
The flavours following on are of tropical 
fruit, lemon and pine, with a dry finish.
